Figure 1:Empirical-support dynamics of RLVR across tasks.Left:Conceptual illustration of empirical support under a thresholdϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ. We define four regions based on whether a correct completiony∗∈𝒞superscript𝑦𝒞y^{*}\in\mathcal{C}italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_Cis assigned non-negligible probability mass by the base modelq𝑞qitalic_qand the RLVR modelπθsubscript𝜋𝜃\pi_{\theta}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT:Empirical Support Preservationcovers completions withq⁢(y∗|x)>ϵ𝑞conditionalsuperscript𝑦𝑥italic-ϵq(y^{*}|x)>\epsilonitalic_q ( italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x ) > italic_ϵandπθ⁢(y∗|x)>ϵsubscript𝜋𝜃conditionalsuperscript𝑦𝑥italic-ϵ\pi_{\theta}(y^{*}|x)>\epsilonitalic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x ) > italic_ϵ;Empirical Support Shrinkageincludes correct completions downweighted by RLVR belowϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ;Empirical Support Expansionincludes completions that RLVR newly upweights aboveϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵdespite negligible base model mass;
andOut of Supportrefers to completions missed by both.Right:Pie charts showing the proportion of completions in each category across diverse reasoning tasks. Support preservation dominates, but shrinkage consistently outweighs expansion—highlighting RLVR’s tendency to sharpen within the base model’s support rather than expand into new solution modes.
Figure 2:Pass@kcurves on tasks like Graph Coloring, Palindrome Generation, and Advanced Geometry, illustrating RLVR’s typicalempirical-support preservation.
Figure 3:Examples ofempirical-support shrinkageon Reasoning Gym tasks such as Leg Counting, Family Relationships, and Power Function.
Figure 4:Rare instances ofempirical-support expansionunder RLVR, as seen in Boxnet, Dice, and Arc 1D tasks.

header: Appendix CPractical Algorithmic Patterns Explained by RLVR Theory
